high.descriptor: Detailed discussion with balanced coverage of open source and proprietary licensing. Clear recommendation with strong justification. Comprehensive coverage of features, legal/ethical issues, and benefits/drawbacks. Evidence is well-structured and clearly communicated.

mid.descriptor: Sound discussion with reasonable coverage of both licence types. Some attempt at recommendation. Coverage of most required elements but may lack depth or balance. Information is supported by limited evidence and the relationship to the evidence may not be clear.

low.descriptor: Limited discussion, may focus on only one licence type. Basic or no recommendation. Limited understanding shown; material is basic and contains inaccuracies. Information is communicated in an unstructured way with limited evidence.

openSourceFeatures: Source code is available to view/modify
openSourceBenefits: Can be modified for specific needs
openSourceDrawbacks: Others could profit from your work
proprietaryDrawbacks: Smaller potential audience due to cost
legalIssues: Open source licences have conditions (e.g. GPL)
ethicalIssues: Proprietary may exclude those who cannot pay

recommendation.expected: Clear choice of open source OR proprietary with justified reasoning based on programmer's goals (income vs reach, control vs community, etc.)

commonMistakes: Focusing on general software quality rather than licensing
Not considering the specific context of a game
examinerComments: Candidates who did well considered both positive and negative aspects of BOTH licence types, gave a clear recommendation, and explicitly addressed legal/ethical issues. Weaker responses were one-sided or discussed generic software issues rather than licensing specifically.

high.descriptor: Detailed discussion considering multiple stakeholder perspectives (customers, shop owners, security staff, privacy advocates). Balanced coverage of benefits and drawbacks. Clear consideration of ethical issues. Well-structured and clearly communicated.

mid.descriptor: Sound discussion with some consideration of different groups. Covers benefits AND drawbacks but may lack balance or depth. Some ethical consideration. Information supported by limited evidence.

low.descriptor: Limited discussion, may be one-sided (only positive OR only negative). Basic understanding of stakeholders. Limited or no ethical consideration. Unstructured with limited evidence.

benefitsToShoppers: Better shopping experience if shops optimised based on tracking data
Lost children could be found quickly
benefitsToCCTVOperators: AI reduces workload - don't need to watch all cameras
drawbacksToShopOwners: May deter customers who value privacy
ethicalIssues: Right to privacy vs public safety
Consent - people may not know they're being tracked
Data security and who has access
Function creep - data used beyond original purpose

commonMistakes: Only discussing CCTV in general, not the AI tracking aspect specifically
One-sided response (entirely positive or entirely negative)
Not considering different groups of people
Generic security discussion without shopping centre context
examinerComments: Strong responses considered both positive and negative sides of using AI in CCTV, gave balanced perspectives from different groups (customers, shop owners, security), and explicitly discussed ethical issues like privacy. Weaker responses focused purely on CCTV in general rather than the specific use of AI for tracking individuals.

high.descriptor: Detailed discussion considering multiple stakeholder perspectives (users, platform owners, content creators, society). Balanced coverage of benefits and drawbacks. Clear consideration of ethical issues. Well-structured.

mid.descriptor: Sound discussion with some consideration of different groups. Covers benefits AND drawbacks but may lack balance. Some ethical consideration. Information supported by limited evidence.

low.descriptor: Limited discussion, may be one-sided. Basic understanding of stakeholders. Limited or no ethical consideration. Unstructured with limited evidence.

benefitsToUsers: Safer online environment, especially for children
benefitsToPlatform: Better reputation if harmful content removed
Can process huge volumes of posts
benefitsToContentCreators: Platform feels safer to post on
Less likely to be targeted by abuse
drawbacksToUsers: False positives - acceptable content removed wrongly
ethicalIssues: Free speech vs protection from harm
Lack of human judgment and context
Transparency - users may not know posts are AI-monitored

commonMistakes: Only discussing AI in general, not social media monitoring specifically
One-sided response (only benefits or only drawbacks)
Not considering different groups of people
Focusing on technical aspects rather than societal impact
examinerComments: Strong responses gave balanced discussions considering both benefits and drawbacks to multiple stakeholder groups, and explicitly addressed ethical concerns such as free speech, bias, and transparency. Weaker responses were entirely one-sided or discussed generic AI topics rather than the specific scenario of social media content monitoring.
